intro: Notocactus neoarechavaletae f. kovaricii, commonly known as the Kovári's notocactus, is a rare and unique cactus species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are typically covered with short, pale spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its green body. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
